授業目的: Students will be introduced to a wide range of communication strategies at the intermediate level.
到達目標: The students will acquire discussion, debate, and critical thinking skills, and they will also learn how to make a presentation.
授業方法: Mostly on Zoom; however, five classes will be face-to-face in the classroom, if permitted.

第1回: 1.      On Zoom: Class requirements and communication activity
第2回: 2.	On Zoom: Unit 1: Greetings and company profiles
第3回: 3.	On-campus, if permitted. Unit 2 Schedules and arrangements; presentation requirements
Create a basic outline for the presentation, review U.2 discussion strategies on page 25
第4回: 4.	On Zoom: Unit 3; Travel and Study Abroad
Complete pages 40-41; do research for presentation.
第5回: Review the vocabulary, and the pros and cons of the newspaper topic for next week’s debate; continue preparations for presentation; study for quiz
第6回: 6.      On-campus, if permitted. Quiz; debate; unit 4: Company logos; describing people/objects
Debate; unit 4: Company logos; describing people/objects
第7回: 7.	On Zoom: Unit 5: Eating out and making requests
Review expressions on page 59 for presentation; complete page 65.
第8回: Complete pages 75 and 77; work on PowerPoint slides for presentation
第9回: 9.      On-campus, if permitted. Unit 8; invitations and offers
第10回: 10.     On Zoom: Unit 9; social media and sports; presentation workshop
Complete page: 113; practice your presentation, following the rubric.
第11回: 11.     On Zoom: Presentations online; how to evaluate presentations
Reflect on your presentation or classmates’ presentation and determine what improvements could be made by using the rubric.
第12回: 12.     On-campus, if permitted. Presentations; how to evaluate presentations
Reflect on your presentation or classmates’ presentation and determine what improvements could be made by using the rubric.
第13回: 13.     On Zoom. Review for examination; unit 10: asking for information

成績評価Grading0: 評価基準等　Grading Criteria etc.
成績評価Grading1: Students' grades will be based on tests, assignments, and oral presentations. No final exam will be given during exam period. Those students who miss five or more classes during the term will receive 0 points for this course.
